title: Shares of several technology companies are trading lower, selling off from Wednesday strength as an increase in coronavirus cases in some US states has led to concerns of a second wave of the virus.

Shares of several technology companies are trading lower as equities sell off following recent rally. Stocks have rallied over the past week amid optimism towards the US economy reopening and investors have potentially taken some profits following run up.
Shares of several companies in the broader technology sector are trading higher as markets rally following strong US jobs data.
Shares of several technology companies are trading higher as equities continue to gain on optimism over an economic reopening as well as a smaller-than-expected drop in nonfarm payrolls.

Shares of several companies in the broader technology sector are trading higher amid market volatility. The sector has performed well, partly due to the work-from-home environment, which has led to greater for virtual communication, e-commerce and software programs.

Shares of several technology companies are trading higher in sympathy with the overall market as equities rally on coronavirus vaccine hopes as well as a pickup in economic activity as some US states reopen businesses.

Shares of several technology companies are trading higher amid market strength as news from a Moderna trial stoked optimism about a potential coronavirus vaccine, which has raised hopes of an economic rebound.

Shares of several technology companies are trading lower amid market weakness, selling off from recent sector strength. Equities have moved lower for the session, potentially related to cautious comments from Fed Chair Powell, who suggested uncertainty and 'significant' downside risks in the economy.
NCR shares are trading lower. Weakness appears market related, as investors weigh concerns of a resurgence in coronavirus cases amid the easing of lockdown restrictions in some US states.

Shares of several technology companies are trading higher as equities gain on continued economic optimism as some US states ease lockdown restrictions. While jobless claims came in worse than estimates, figures were lower than in prior weeks.

Shares of several technology companies are trading lower on market weakness as investor uncertainty grows following quarterly earnings results from multiple companies. NOTE: This could potentially be a sell-off after the S&P 500 rallied 12.7% over the past month.

Shares of several technology companies are trading lower amid market weakness following US jobless claims and consumer spending data.
Earnings Scheduled For April 30, 2020

Shares of several technology companies are trading higher as equities gain strength on news that some U.S. states will reopen their economies in phases, increasing economic activity and optimism around the coronavirus pandemic.

Shares of several technology companies are trading higher as markets gain on optimistic coronavirus outlook following positive remdesivir data from Gilead. Hopes of a treatment candidate have raised hopes of a rebound in economic activity in the future.

Shares of several technology companies are trading lower as equities dip amid mixed earnings results from banks, a significant decline in the price of oil and worse than expected retail sales in March.

Shares of several technology companies are trading lower amid uncertainty around demand outlook caused by the coronavirus pandemic which has significantly staggered consumer spending and economic activity.
